title: Pro Log: Annemiek van Vleuten retires, Wout van Aert wins Tour of Britain as TdT-Unibet win hearts, Jumbo-Visma 1-2-3 at La Vuelta
content:
Cyclist
Pro Log: Annemiek van Vleuten retires, Wout van Aert wins Tour of Britain as TdT-Unibet win hearts, Jumbo-Visma 1-2-3 at La Vuelta

Welcome back to another edition of Pro Log. It‚Äôs currently the final rest day at the Vuelta a Espa√±a and Sepp Kuss (Jumbo-Visma) still leads the general classification by 1:37 over teammate Primo≈æ Rogliƒç. It‚Äôs a Jumbo-Visma 1-2-3 on GC as Jonas Vingegaard sits 1:44 down heading into the final week.

Results powered by FirstCycling.com

Carlos Rodr√≠guez (Ineos Grenadiers) soloed to victory on the final stage of the Tour of Britain as Wout van Aert (Jumbo-Visma) claimed the overall title, while Lotte Kopecky (SD Worx) won both the final stage and GC of the Simac Ladies Tour.

Annemiek van Vleuten retires

Annemiek van Vleuten crosses the finish for the final time as a professional cyclist

What a career, what a rider @Movistar_Team | @AvVleuten pic.twitter.com/yOJjgVTt53

‚Äî Eurosport (@eurosport) September 10, 2023

One of the greatest cyclists of all time. I just covered Annemiek van Vleuten‚Äôs retirement in my latest In the Drops and the 40-year-old officially retired from road racing after the Simac Ladies Tour, where she spent the final lap of her career waving to fans on the roadside.

With 104 UCI wins, Van Vleuten leaves behind a legacy as one of the most successful cyclists to ever grace the road with her presence. She won the Giro d‚ÄôItalia Donne, Tour de France Femmes and La Vuelta Femenina as well as Monuments in Li√®ge-Bastogne-Li√®ge and the Tour of Flanders, European and World Championships plus Olympic gold. A glittering career. Cycling will miss her, but I‚Äôm looking forward to seeing what one of the GOATs gets up to next.

Jumbo-Visma 1-2-3 x2

Sepp Kuss wears the red jersey at La Vuelta as Jumbo-Visma try to sweep all three Grand Tours in 2023. The American was a pivotal rider in his teammates‚Äô victories this year ‚Äì Primo≈æ Rogliƒç‚Äôs Giro d‚ÄôItalia win in May and Jonas Vingegaaard‚Äôs Tour de France defence in July ‚Äì and, granted, was not the man most expected to sit atop GC standings at the Vuelta a Espa√±a. He won Stage 6 and worked his way into red just two days later. His time to shine was unforeseen but welcomed. Who had Kuss leading the Vuelta with a serious shot at victory on their bingo cards at the beginning of the race?

The Jumbo-Visma team truly asserted their dominance on Stage 13 ‚Äì unlucky for some, not for them clearly ‚Äì up to the Col du Tourmalet. Vingegaard climbed to victory as Kuss and Rogliƒç completed the day‚Äôs podium behind. With Soudal-QuickStep‚Äôs Remco Evenepoel almost half an hour down (he won the stage the next day, eight minutes ahead of the peloton), who is left to challenge the dominant Jumbo-Visma?

A Spanish quartet is behind them on GC in UAE Team Emirates‚Äô Juan Ayuso (2:37), Movistar‚Äôs Enric Mas (3:06), Ayuso‚Äôs teammate Marc Soler (3:10) and Mikel Landa of Bahrain Victorious (4:12). Perhaps an alliance is on the cards to spice up the final week‚Ä¶

Wout van Aert and TdT-Unibet winners at the Tour of Britain

Thought Jumbo-Visma were only dominating at the Vuelta? Think again. Wout van Aert led out sprinter Olav Kooij to a whopping four stage wins in a row at the Tour of Britain. Van Aert then won Stage 5 through a solo breakaway, just holding off Ethan Vernon (Great Britain) and Danny van Poppel (Bora-Hansgrohe).

Those three seconds claimed on Stage 5 meant Van Aert claimed overall victory at the Tour of Britain ahead of Tobias Johannessen (Uno X) and Damien Howson (Q36.5). Magnus Sheffield (Ineos Grenadiers) topped the youth classification standings, Kooij took home the points jersey and James Fouch√© (Bolton Equities Black Spoke) won the mountains classification.

Sidenote: how entertaining were Dutch Continental team TdT-Unibet?

The yellow numbers are back!

Job well done, @WYP_ceg.#TourofBritain pic.twitter.com/EE1aofERKf

‚Äî Tour de Tietema (@tourdetietema) September 9, 2023

Not only lighting up the roads (my Harry Tanfield prediction was strong) but social media too. Whether it was editing video memes or getting a member of the Central Escort Group of police motorcyclists on stage with them ‚Äì who looked delighted to be handed the yellow numbers/combativity award by Abram Stockman, above ‚Äì their antics were a welcome sight. Especially when you could predict the stage winner for the first four days.

See you next week.
